summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Laura Menninger and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding discovery issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, specifically concerning discrepancies in the number of 'Highly Confidential' images and videos, logistical problems with evidence review, and concerns about the government's handling of photographic evidence.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell; raising concerns about discovery deficiencies, specifically the number and availability of 'Highly Confidential' images and videos.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence regarding discovery issues in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence regarding discovery issues in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the case; her defense team is seeking to review evidence, including 'Highly Confidential' materials, on her behalf.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the source of seized materials, including images and videos from his New York and Virgin Islands residences and devices.

connections.description: Menninger is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case, advocating for her right to review discovery materials.
Maxwell is accused of conspiring with Epstein in the sexual abuse scheme; evidence is seized from Epstein's properties.
Corresponding regarding discovery disputes and evidence review logistics in the criminal prosecution.

events.title: Evidence Review at 500 Pearl Street
events.description: Defense counsel reviewed approximately 5,500 'Highly Confidential' images from two hard drives at 500 Pearl Street in New York.

events.title: Production of Confidential Images
events.description: Government produced a set of confidential images to the defense.

events.title: Judge Nathan's Order
events.description: Reference to a court order (Dkt. No. 322) prompting a meet-and-confer between prosecution and defense.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date
events.description: Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for November 29, 2021.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY (location of initial evidence review)
Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) (where Maxwell was held and evidence was to be reviewed)
4624 Central Park Blvd, Denver, CO (FBI office for evidence review)
Epstein's New York residence (source of seized CDs)
Epstein's Virgin Islands residence (source of seized electronic devices)
1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
150 10th Avenue, Denver, CO 80203 (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman law office)
keyFacts: A significant discrepancy exists in the count of 'Highly Confidential' images: initially 5,500 were made available for review, but an FBI 302 report indicates 33,747 images and 895 videos, a difference of approximately 35,000 items.

The defense alleges that the majority of photographic materials (tens of thousands of images/videos) had not been made available for review more than a year after the case began and two months before the scheduled trial.

Evidence includes images and videos recovered from CDs seized from Epstein's New York residence and from electronic devices seized during his arrest and searches of his New York and Virgin Islands residences.
The defense raised serious concerns about the functionality of discovery, including corrupt files, missing metadata, unreadable file formats, and problems with evidence review at the MDC.
The prosecution acknowledged a miscommunication with the FBI regarding the number of HC images but maintained the correct number was on the hard drives provided for review.
